snippet: Japan’s conservative government backed away from earlier suggestions that it might try to revise or even repudiate apologies to sex slaves and other nations.
abstract: Japan’s conservative government backed away from earlier suggestions that it might try to revise or even repudiate apologies made in 1993 to to sex slaves and other victims of country's aggression in World War II.
lead_paragraph: Japan’s conservative government backed away from earlier suggestions that it might try to revise or even repudiate apologies to sex slaves and other nations.

headline.seo: Japan Says It Will Abide by Apologies Over War
headline.main: Japan Says It Will Abide by Apologies Over Actions in World War II
headline.print_headline: Japan Says It Will Abide by Apologies Over Actions in World War II
